title: Free-to-play Smithing training

properties.name: description
properties.value: This guide outlines the best methods for training the Smithing skill in free-to-play. There are a few ways to profit with Smithing in free-to-play, such as smelting bars or making rune equipment, however it is more beneficial to simply perform the fastest experience methods and use the saved time to make money from alternative methods.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Free-to-play Smithing training
For a list of furnaces, see Furnace.

This guide outlines the best methods for training the Smithing skill in free-to-play. There are a few ways to profit with Smithing in free-to-play, such as smelting bars or making rune equipment, however it is more beneficial to simply perform the fastest experience methods and use the saved time to make money from alternative methods.

Experience gained is based off the number of bars used, therefore using larger amounts of bars at once yields the highest experience rates, meaning Smithing platebodies is always the fastest experience.

Contents

  • 1 Efficient training
    • 1.1 Levels 1-29: The Knight's Sword
    • 1.2 Levels 1-5: Bronze axes
    • 1.3 Levels 5-9: Bronze scimitars
    • 1.4 Levels 9-18: Bronze warhammers
    • 1.5 Levels 18/29-33: Bronze platebodies
    • 1.6 Level 33-48: Iron platebodies
    • 1.7 Level 48-68: Steel platebodies
    • 1.8 Level 68-88: Mithril platebodies
    • 1.9 Level 88-98: Adamant platebodies
    • 1.10 Level 98-99: Rune equipment
  • 2 Alternative methods
    • 2.1 Smithing and alching
  • 3 Smelting Table

Efficient training[edit | edit source]

Levels 1-29: The Knight's Sword[edit | edit source]

It is highly recommended to complete The Knight's Sword quest immediately for the reward of 12,725 Smithing experience, enough to level Smithing from 1 to 29.

Levels 1-5: Bronze axes[edit | edit source]

Smith bronze axes to level 5 for 12.5 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 0
  • Experience required: 388
  • Ending experience: 400
  • Bronze bars required: 32
  • Input cost: 7,872
  • Profit: −5,952 coins (−186 each)

Levels 5-9: Bronze scimitars[edit | edit source]

Smith bronze scimitars from levels 5 to 9 for 25 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 400
  • Experience required: 569
  • Ending experience: 575
  • Bronze bars required: 46
  • Input cost: 11,316
  • Profit: −8,418 coins (−366 each)

Levels 9-18: Bronze warhammers[edit | edit source]

Smith bronze warhammers from levels 9 to 18 for 37.5 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 975
  • Experience required: 2,548
  • Ending experience: 2,550
  • Bronze bars required: 204
  • Input cost: 50,184
  • Profit: −41,616 coins (−671 each)

Levels 18/29-33: Bronze platebodies[edit | edit source]

Smith bronze platebodies from levels 18 or 29, if The Knight's Sword has been completed, to 33 for 62.5 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 3,525
  • Experience required: 14,722
  • Ending experience: 14,750
  • Bronze bars required: 1,180
  • Input cost: 290,280
  • Profit: −277,536 coins (−1,176 each)

Starting at 29:

  • Starting experience: 12,725
  • Experience required: 5,522
  • Ending experience: 5,562.5
  • Bronze bars required: 445 (299 bars if you are smelting the bars yourself)
  • Input cost: 109,470
  • Profit: −104,664 coins (−1,176 each)

Level 33-48: Iron platebodies[edit | edit source]

Smith iron platebodies from levels 33 to 48 for 125 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 18,287.5
  • Experience required: 64,726.5
  • Ending experience: 64,750
  • Iron bars required: 2,590 (1,735 bars if you are smelting[1] the bars yourself)
  • Input cost: 473,970
  • Profit: −421,134 coins (−813 each)

Level 48-68: Steel platebodies[edit | edit source]

Smith steel platebodies from level 48 to 68 for 187.5 experience each.

  • Starting experience: 83,037.5
  • Experience required: 521,994.5
  • Ending experience 522,000
  • Steel bars required: 13,920 (9,491 bars if you are smelting the bars yourself)
  • Input cost: 6,375,360
  • Profit: −3,911,520 coins (−1,405 each)

Level 68-88: Mithril platebodies[edit | edit source]

Smith mithril platebodies from levels 68 to 88 for 250 experience each. This is about 150,000 to 176,000 experience per hour.

  • Starting experience: 605,037.5
  • Experience required: 3,780,738.5
  • Ending experience: 3,780,750
  • Mithril bars required: 75,615
  • Input cost: 56,635,635
  • Profit: −14,986,893 coins (−991 each)

Level 88-98: Adamant platebodies[edit | edit source]

Smith adamant platebodies from levels 88 to 98 for 312.5 experience each. This is about 215,000 experience per hour with the use of energy potions.

  • Starting experience: 4,385,787.5
  • Experience required: 7,419,818.5
  • Ending experience: 7,420,000
  • Adamant bars required: 118,720
  • Input cost: 238,033,600
  • Profit: −12,631,808 coins (−532 each)

Level 98-99: Rune equipment[edit | edit source]

Smith rune platebodies for the fastest experience at level 98 for 375 experience each by drinking a dwarven stout for a +1 Smithing boost for one minute. Maintain energy with energy potions.

Alternatively, to save money smith with lower experience rates, smith rune platelegs, rune plateskirts, or rune 2h swords to sell or cast High Alchemy on for profit.

Rune platebody:

  • Starting experience: 11,805,787.5
  • Experience required: 1,228,643.5
  • Runite bars required: 16,385
  • Input cost: 203,780,245
  • Profit: −77,671,454 coins (−23,702 each)

Other rune items:

  • Runite bars required: 16,383
  • Input cost: 203,755,371
  • Rune platelegs profit: 2,675,890 coins (490 each)
  • Rune plateskirt profit: 3,129,153 coins (573 each)
  • Rune 2h sword profit: 2,992,628 coins (548 each)

Alternative methods[edit | edit source]

Smithing and alching[edit | edit source]

When smithing mithril platebodies, adamant platebodies, rune 2h swords, rune plateskirts, or rune platelegs, you can cast High Alchemy on them to profit even more than selling them. Equip a staff of fire with nature runes, a hammer, an inventory space for coins and cast the spell while running back to the bank. Two platebodies can be alchemised when running and 3 when walking. This is a click-intensive method, so alternatively after accumulating many of them, it is possible to AFK alchemise them instead. This will lower Smithing experience rates for more profit and some Magic experience. It is never profitable to buy steel bars, smith a steel platebody, and then cast High Level Alchemy on it.

Alternatively, trade them to an alternate account to alchemise while continuing to smith on the main account to avoid lowering experience per hour.

  • Mithril platebody profit with High Alchemy: −799
  • Adamant platebody profit with High Alchemy: −215
  • Rune 2h sword profit with High Alchemy: 915
  • Rune plateskirt profit with High Alchemy: 915
  • Rune platelegs profit with High Alchemy: 915

Smelting Table[edit | edit source]

This table shows which bars are worth making from ores:

Bar Level Experience Ore
required		 Input cost GE Price Profit
Bronze bar 1 6.2 ×1
×1 		149 246 97
Iron bar 15 12.5 ×1 63
70.17[1] 		183 28.5
112.83[1]
Silver bar 20 13.67 ×1 50 90 40
Steel bar 30 17.5 ×1
×2 		397 458 61
Gold bar 40 22.5 ×1 283 87 −196
Mithril bar 50 30 ×1
×4 		784 749 −35
Adamantite bar 70 37.5 ×1
×6 		2,057 2,005 −52
Runite bar 85 50 ×1
×8 		12,400 12,437 37
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 This is based on using the Ring of forging for smelting, guaranteeing successful smelting of iron.

{{External|rs}} {{Otheruses|def=no|a list of furnaces|Furnace}} This [[Skill training guides|guide]] outlines the best methods for training the [[Smithing]] [[skill]] in [[free-to-play]]. There are a few ways to profit with Smithing in free-to-play, such as smelting [[bar]]s or making [[rune equipment]], however it is more beneficial to simply perform the fastest experience methods and use the saved time to make money from alternative methods. Experience gained is based off the number of bars used, therefore using larger amounts of bars at once yields the highest experience rates, meaning Smithing [[platebodies]] is always the fastest experience. ==Efficient training== ===Levels 1-29: The Knight's Sword=== It is highly recommended to complete [[The Knight's Sword]] [[quest]] immediately for the reward of 12,725 [[Smithing]] experience, enough to level Smithing from 1 to 29. ===Levels 1-5: Bronze axes=== Smith [[bronze axe]]s to level 5 for 12.5 experience each. * Starting [[experience]]: 0 * Experience required: 388 * Ending experience: 400 * [[Bronze bar]]s required: 32 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze bar|32}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze axe|32}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|32}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Bronze axe}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar}})}} each) ===Levels 5-9: Bronze scimitars=== Smith [[bronze scimitar]]s from levels 5 to 9 for 25 experience each. * Starting experience: 400 * Experience required: 569 * Ending experience: 575 * [[Bronze bar]]s required: 46 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze bar|46}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze scimitar|23}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|204}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Bronze warhammer}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|3}})}} each) ===Levels 18/29-33: Bronze platebodies=== Smith [[bronze platebodies]] from levels 18 or 29, if [[The Knight's Sword]] has been completed, to 33 for 62.5 experience each. * Starting experience: 3,525 * Experience required: 14,722 * Ending experience: 14,750 * [[Bronze bar]]s required: 1,180 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze bar|1180}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze platebody|236}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|1180}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Bronze platebody}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|5}})}} each) Starting at 29: * Starting experience: 12,725 * Experience required: 5,522 * Ending experience: 5,562.5 * [[Bronze bar]]s required: 445 (299 bars if you are smelting the bars yourself) * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze bar|445}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Bronze platebody|89}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|445}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Bronze platebody}} - {{GEP|Bronze bar|5}})}} each) ===Level 33-48: Iron platebodies=== Smith [[iron platebodies]] from levels 33 to 48 for 125 experience each. * Starting experience: 18,287.5 * Experience required: 64,726.5 * Ending experience: 64,750 * [[Iron bar]]s required: 2,590 (1,735 bars if you are smeltingThis is based on using the [[Ring of forging]] for smelting, guaranteeing successful smelting of iron. the bars yourself) * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Iron bar|2590}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Iron platebody|518}} - {{GEP|Iron bar|2590}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Iron platebody}} - {{GEP|Iron bar|5}})}} each) ===Level 48-68: Steel platebodies=== Smith [[steel platebodies]] from level 48 to 68 for 187.5 experience each. * Starting experience: 83,037.5 * Experience required: 521,994.5 * Ending experience 522,000 * [[Steel bar]]s required: 13,920 (9,491 bars if you are smelting the bars yourself) * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Steel bar|13920}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Steel platebody|2784}} - {{GEP|Steel bar|13920}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Steel platebody}} - {{GEP|Steel bar|5}})}} each) ===Level 68-88: Mithril platebodies=== Smith [[mithril platebodies]] from levels 68 to 88 for 250 experience each. This is about 150,000 to 176,000 experience per hour. * Starting experience: 605,037.5 * Experience required: 3,780,738.5 * Ending experience: 3,780,750 * [[Mithril bar]]s required: 75,615 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Mithril bar|75615}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Mithril platebody|15123}} - {{GEP|Mithril bar|75615}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Mithril platebody}} - {{GEP|Mithril bar|5}})}} each) ===Level 88-98: Adamant platebodies=== Smith [[adamant platebodies]] from levels 88 to 98 for 312.5 experience each. This is about 215,000 experience per hour with the use of [[energy potion]]s. * Starting experience: 4,385,787.5 * Experience required: 7,419,818.5 * Ending experience: 7,420,000 * [[Adamant bar]]s required: 118,720 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Adamantite bar|118720}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Adamant platebody|23744}} - {{GEP|Adamantite bar|118720}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Adamant platebody}} - {{GEP|Adamantite bar|5}})}} each) ===Level 98-99: Rune equipment=== Smith [[rune platebodies]] for the fastest experience at level 98 for 375 experience each by drinking a [[dwarven stout]] for a +1 Smithing boost for one minute. Maintain [[energy]] with [[energy potion]]s. Alternatively, to save money smith with lower experience rates, smith [[rune platelegs]], [[rune plateskirt]]s, or [[rune 2h sword]]s to sell or cast [[High Alchemy]] on for profit. Rune platebody: * Starting experience: 11,805,787.5 * Experience required: 1,228,643.5 * [[Runite bar]]s required: 16,385 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite bar|16385}}}} * Profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Rune platebody|3277}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|16385}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Rune platebody}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|5}})}} each) Other rune items: * [[Runite bar]]s required: 16,383 * Input cost: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Runite bar|16383}}}} * Rune platelegs profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Rune platelegs|5461}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|16383}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Rune platelegs}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}})}} each) * Rune plateskirt profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Rune plateskirt|5461}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|16383}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Rune plateskirt}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}})}} each) * Rune 2h sword profit: {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Rune 2h sword|5461}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|16383}}}} coins ({{Coins|({{GEP|Rune 2h sword}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}})}} each) ==Alternative methods== ===Smithing and alching=== When smithing [[mithril platebodies]], [[adamant platebodies]], [[rune 2h sword]]s, [[rune plateskirt]]s, or [[rune plateleg]]s, you can cast [[High Alchemy]] on them to profit even more than selling them. Equip a [[staff of fire]] with [[nature rune]]s, a [[hammer]], an inventory space for coins and cast the spell while running back to the bank. Two platebodies can be alchemised when running and 3 when walking. This is a click-intensive method, so alternatively after accumulating many of them, it is possible to AFK alchemise them instead. This will lower Smithing experience rates for more profit and some Magic experience. It is '''never''' profitable to buy [[steel bar]]s, smith a [[steel platebody]], and then cast [[High Level Alchemy]] on it. Alternatively, trade them to an alternate account to alchemise while continuing to smith on the main account to avoid lowering experience per hour. * Mithril platebody profit with High Alchemy: {{Coins|{{Alch|Mithril platebody}} - {{GEP|Nature rune}} - {{GEP|Mithril bar|5}}}} * Adamant platebody profit with High Alchemy: {{Coins|{{Alch|Adamant platebody}} - {{GEP|Nature rune}} - {{GEP|Adamantite bar|5}}}} * Rune 2h sword profit with High Alchemy: {{Coins|{{Alch|Rune 2h sword}} - {{GEP|Nature rune}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}}}} * Rune plateskirt profit with High Alchemy: {{Coins|{{Alch|Rune plateskirt}} - {{GEP|Nature rune}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}}}} * Rune platelegs profit with High Alchemy: {{Coins|{{Alch|Rune platelegs}} - {{GEP|Nature rune}} - {{GEP|Runite bar|3}}}} ==Smelting Table== This table shows which bars are worth making from ores: {|class="wikitable align-center-5" !colspan="2"|Bar!!{{SCP|Smithing}} Level!!Experience!!Ore
